url.imageAlt: A black and white photo of over a dozen men behind a sign that says “silence” in big bold letters
A photo of the gardens at Jackson Park
A photo of a large fake Christmas tree covered in white twinkly lights shining at night
A man and woman with their two greyhounds kneeling inside of a big metal dome covered with white Christmas lights
A big bright maple leaf shaped arch glowing red at night
Two old fighter plane monuments displayed on poles
A front view of the fighter plane monuments showing a large stone slab in front with small writing inscribed
A stone pillar stands in the grass next to the walkways at Jackson Park
A large stone wall monument with a half fountain and various plaques attached
A large shelter with a sign that says “Queen Elizabeth II Gardens” is decorated for Christmas and attended by families

description: In September 1946, 20 parks employees were given the power to arrest and the start of the “War Against Sex Crimes Campaign” began.
In 1986, police targeted queer men at Jackson Park.
